Module ZiqiYang
Package org.ziqi.gameEngine

Class GraphicUnitRenderer

java.lang.Object
org.ziqi.gameEngine.GraphicUnitRenderer
public class GraphicUnitRenderer
extends java.lang.Object
GraphicUnitRenderer class takes charge of rendering graphic units of specific GameObjects on gaming screen.
Each type of GameObject will be rendered as a graphic unit on its corresponding layer(AnchorPane) of gaming screen.
Author:
Ziqi Yang
See Also:
GraphicUnit, GamingScreen, GamingScreenController

  • Method Details

    • renderObjectToGraphic

      public static void renderObjectToGraphic​(GameObject[] gameObjects, javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane[] layers)
      Generates and renders one set of graphic units on given layers accordingly by given GameObject array at the same position.
      This method will be called by GamingScreenController class everytime when the screen needs to be updated, as a user is playing the game(gaming screen is showing) and inputs a key that is handled;
      Parameters:
      gameObjects - Array of GameObjects provided by level iterator as all layers of objects at the same position.
      layers - Array of AnchorPanes that will shows the whole rendered level(layers of graphic units)
      See Also:
      GamingScreenController, GamingScreenController.updateGamingScreen(), Level.LevelIterator, GraphicUnit

    • renderCrateGraphic

      private static void renderCrateGraphic​(Crate crateModel, GraphicUnit crateGraphic, java.awt.Point position)
      Renders Crate object on its specific AnchorPane layer at given position.
      This method will check the status of the Crate object and render different effect accordingly:
      If the crate is sealing, meaning the last move of player must be pushing the crate to hit a diamond, then a blooming animation with music will be played and render the sealed graphic on finished.
      Otherwise, a normal graphic of the crate is then rendered by setUpGraphicLayout() method.
      Note: When an animation is playing, player input handler is temporarily unsubscribed to avoid refresh off the animation.
      Parameters:
      crateModel - Crate object to be checked and rendered.
      crateGraphic - The default graphic for crate, meaning the crate has not yet hit any diamond.
      position - Point object specifying the position to be rendered on the layer.
      See Also:
      Crate, Crate.CrateStatus, setUpGraphicLayout(GraphicUnit, Point, double, double), MusicManager.playBloomingMusic(), EventManager.subscribe(), EventManager.unsubscribe()

    • renderPlayerGraphic

      private static void renderPlayerGraphic​(GraphicUnit playerGraphic, java.awt.Point position)
      Renders Player object on its specific AnchorPane layer at given position.
      This method will check the current status of the Player object and render different effect accordingly:
      1. If the Player is FLYING_OFF, an animation with flying-off music will be played and then a flying graphic is rendered on finish;
      2. If the Player is LANDING, the renderer check if the player can land: If so, an animation with landing music will be played and then the idle graphic is render on finished; Otherwise, the cannotLand sound effect is played to alert player.
      3. If the Player is PUSHING/FLYING/IDLE, then the according graphic and music will be normally renderer.
      Note: When an animation is playing, player input handler is temporarily unsubscribed to avoid refresh off the animation.
      Parameters:
      playerGraphic - Player object to be checked and rendered.
      position - Point object specifying the position to be rendered on the layer.
      See Also:
      Player, Player.PlayerStatus, setUpGraphicLayout(GraphicUnit, Point, double, double), MusicManager.playFlyingOffMusic(), MusicManager.playLandingMusic(), MusicManager.playCannotLandMusic(), MusicManager.playPushingMusic(), EventManager.subscribe(), EventManager.unsubscribe()

    • setUpGraphicLayout

      private static void setUpGraphicLayout​(GraphicUnit graphicUnit, java.awt.Point position, double offsetX, double offsetY)

    • addDropShadow

      private static void addDropShadow​(javafx.scene.image.ImageView imageView)
      Adds shadow effect on player graphic when player is flying.
      Parameters:
      imageView - The Player graphic to be added.
      See Also:
      DropShadow, Effect
